sources.title: Submarine Command (1951) William Holden · Don Taylor
sources.description: An American submarine officer suffers from feelings of guilt because he feels partly responsible for the captain's death and compensates for this by demonstrating exceptional courage in the Korean War.   It's routine entertainment that uses the war as a backdrop for thrilling adventure. ..

metadata.Plot: Submarine commander Ken White is forced to suddenly submerge, leaving his captain and another crew member to die outside the sub during WW II. Subsequent years of meaningless navy ground assignments and the animosity of a former sailor, leave White (now a captain) feeling guilty and empty. His life spirals downward and his wife is about to leave him. Suddenly, he is forced into a dangerous rescue situation at the start of the Koren War.... reassigned to the same submarine where all of his problems began.
metadata.Actors: William Holden, Nancy Olson, William Bendix
